page.title: 07FARMING IN CHILMARK/TEFFONT
page.content: {Farms}are large on the{chalk downs. {1,000 acres}is not exceptional.Only one farm now keeps{dairy cattle}and that is on the{clays}and{greensand which lie below the chalk. Apart from this, the survey area is mostly under {arable,}especially the{intensive {cultivation}of{wheat}and{barley,}with much use of{fertilisers and pesticides Some other crops, such as{oats, {oilseed rape, and peas}are grown in rotation. Intensively managed grass, usually in rotation, supports{store {cattle}and an increasing number of {sheep,}as well as crops of hay and {silage}for winter feed. {Heavy horses}are bred in Teffont, and {race horses}at a stud farm between the two villages. In Chilmark{special {wheat}is grown for{thatching straw, cut with a binder not with a combine, and dried in stooks. AMcG
